Class STV

  • java.lang.Object
    • STV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VotingAlgorithm

    public class STV
extends java.lang.Object
implements VotingAlgorithm

    STV Class

    The STV class calculates the result of an election when STV is the chosen algorithm. It calculates the Droop quota and distributes votes according to the STV algorithm, choosing winners and losers to add to the lists in Election along the way.
    Author:
    Allison Miller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      STV(Election e)
      STV's constructor sets the class variables, calculating the Droop quota and getting the overall list of ballots from the Election parameter for initial distribution.

    • Method Detail

      • calcDroopQuota

        public int calcDroopQuota()
        Calculates the Droop quota using the formula: floor(numBallots/(numSeats+1)) + 1 If the number of seats is negative, defaults to 1.
        Returns:
        calculated Droop quota

      • distributeVotes

        public void distributeVotes()
        Distributes the current set of ballots among the remaining candidates. Finds the highest ranked candidate for each ballot that has not yet been declared a winner or a loser and assigns that ballot to them.

        If the ballot is the first that the candidate has received, adds them to the tie-breaking stack.

        If the additional ballot causes the candidate to reach the Droop quota, they are removed from the list of candidates and added to the list of winners.

        If all of the ranked candidates on the ballot have already been declared winners or losers, nothing is done with the ballot.

        Specified by:
        distributeVotes in interface VotingAlgorithm

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate()
        Evaluates the election. Shuffles the ballots if desired, then begins the distribution loop. For each round, evaluate distributes the current list of ballots (and selects winners if any were found, as described in distributeVotes), removes the loser, and stores their ballots for redistribution in the next round.

        If any seats are left open after all candidates have been declared winners or losers, evaluate fills the winners list with the most recent losers.

        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface VotingAlgorithm
